definition: the lower of two berths, look angry or sullen, wrinkle one's forehead, as if to signal disapproval
details:
noun
- the lower of two berths
= synonyms: lower berth
verb
- look angry or sullen, wrinkle one's forehead, as if to signal disapproval
= synonyms: glower
- make lower or quieter
= synonyms: lour, turn down
- set lower
= example: set lower
= synonyms: lour
- cause to drop or sink
= synonyms: depress
- move something or somebody to a lower position
= synonyms: get down, bring down, take down, let down
